definition: doing something in opposition to another way of doing it that you don't like
details:
noun
- doing something in opposition to another way of doing it that you don't like
= example: doing something in opposition to another way of doing it that you don't like
- a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some antecedent stimulus or agent
= example: a bodily process occurring due to the effect of some antecedent stimulus or agent
= synonyms: response
- an idea evoked by some experience
= example: an idea evoked by some experience
- extreme conservatism in political or social matters
= example: extreme conservatism in political or social matters
- a response that reveals a person's feelings or attitude
= example: a response that reveals a person's feelings or attitude
- (mechanics) the equal and opposite force that is produced when any force is applied to a body
= example: (mechanics) the equal and opposite force that is produced when any force is applied to a body
- (chemistry) a process in which one or more substances are changed into others
= example: (chemistry) a process in which one or more substances are changed into others
= synonyms: chemical reaction
